data.title: Husks don't chronoshift back to original location
Friend System or Chat System idea.
data.body: ok heres an idea,  i don't know how hard it is to make it , but It would be cool if there was something like a Friend System, or a Chatbox in the main multiplayer lobby, so you can see who might be online waiting for a game and maybe talk to them :)

data.title: Retry loading of mix file
data.body:
Binaries built by mono and running on Windows exhibit a bug where the parsing the the mix file will occasionally produce garbage results. Retrying the operation is sufficient to mitigate the issue.

---

This should prevent any more crashes due to #2441 for now, until there is time for somebody to investigate the root cause of the problem and have a proper fix implemented.

(Many thanks to @pi99y for their tireless efforts in helping to investigate the issue)

data.title: Fixed silo placement preview
data.body:
Rather than applying some magic work-around to `WithSpriteBody` preview code, I opted for giving `WithSiloAnimation` its own `Sequence` property, allowing us to split sequences into normal, 1-frame `idle` and fill `stages` sequence.

Fixes #9345.

data.title: Silo placement preview is broken
data.body: It cycles through all frames of `idle`.

data.title: Fixed RotationPaletteEffect tileset validity check
data.body:
Fixes a regression from #9103, RA temperate/snow terrain water effect is currently broken on bleed.

If `Tilesets` was empty but `ExcludeTilesets` was not, it would always return `false` even though that combination is supposed to mean only the excluded tileset(s) is/are not valid for this effect.

data.title: PaletteReference Lint check doesn't handle player palettes properly
data.body:
...when they are enabled via boolean.
Example: the D2k deviator trail palette (#9340).
It gives a lint error even though there is nothing wrong with the yaml and everything works fine in-game.

The only reason it didn't error before was that the deviator used `Bullet` projectile, which lacks a `[PaletteReference]` for the `TrailPalette`.

data.title: Organize map data in Manifest
data.body:
This is step one toward the so-called "diamond maps", starting off with some simple, barely related refactoring.
The point of this PR is combining `TileSize`, `TileShape` and `SubCells` from `Manifest` (`mod.yaml`) into a `MapGrid` field.
The results are most visible in TS's `mod.yaml`.

data.title: Some D2k cleanup
data.body:
- removed Parachutable from infantry default
- Carryalls and Ornithopters are now targetable by anti-air missiles like in the original
- removed redundant airborne upgrade from aircraft that can't land or isn't targetable

data.title: Changed D2k health, armor types and weapon stats to match original
data.body: A large chunk from #9106.

data.title: Makes only concrete walls block fire
data.body:
And clean up TS `^Wall` default.

Closes #9320.

data.title: Add support for EditorTemplateOrder auto-generation
data.body: As the TS/RA2 tilesets are big, it is more convenient to generate this automatically as well.

data.title: Make DuplicateUnitCrateAction only check enabled targetability
data.body:
Make DuplicateUnitCrateAction only use enabled `ITargetable` traits for valid target check.
Missed this in #8727.

data.title: TraitInfo through ActorInfo and HasTrait Removal
data.body:
Split and rebased from #8927; the reason for taking the earlier commits is the discussion about LINQ-like methods in the comments for #8927.

_selfOrOtherActor_`.HasTrait<`_Trait_`>()` => _selfOrOtherActor_`.Info.HasTraitInfo<`_TraitInfo_`>`
 // with ITraitInfo restriction

_actorInfo_`.Traits.Contains` => _actorInfo_`.HasTraitInfo` // with ITraitInfo restriction

_actorInfo_`.Traits.Get` => _actorInfo_`.TraitInfo` // with ITraitInfo restriction

_actorInfo_`.Traits.GetOrDefault` => _actorInfo_`.TraitInfoOrDefault` // with ITraitInfo restriction

Foundation for a future PR for reducing trait access and allocation where trait state is not needed.

Separated because a few of these changes were put in #8848 to reduce ordering (`InitializeAfter<>`) and requirement (`Requires<>`) requirements and @pchote requested the changes be made everywhere before the split (`Requires<>` => `Requires<>` and `InitializeAfter<>`) in #8848.

Almost all of this is just `for f in $(git grep -lF ...); do sed -i s/.../.../g $f; done` substitutions with 1 method removed from `Actor` and 3 wrapper methods with `where T : ITraitInfo` added to `ActorInfo`.

@RoosterDragon profile this one.

data.title: Melee ant and zombie fix
data.body:
I noticed that Ants can't attack diagonal.
Mandible: are using 1c0 as range. Also found zombie with claw does the same.

ants and zombies should get fixed to 1c256 or 1c512.

data.title: playtest 20150830; cnc; Can't find NavalProduction in the HackyAI BuildingCommonNames definition.
data.body:
playtest 20150830
Mod: cnc; Map: Haos Ridges
Skirmish: Human vs. 3 bots, 1 of each type

A couple/few minutes into the game, it will crash with the following error:

Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Can't find NavalProduction in the HackyAI BuildingCommonNames definition.
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.AI.BaseBuilder.GetProducibleBuilding (System.String commonName, IEnumerable`1 buildables, System.Func`2 orderBy) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.AI.BaseBuilder.ChooseBuildingToBuild (OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.ProductionQueue queue) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.AI.BaseBuilder.TickQueue (OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.ProductionQueue queue) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.AI.BaseBuilder.Tick () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.AI.HackyAI.Tick (OpenRA.Actor self) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.World.<Tick>m__3 (TraitPair`1 x) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at (wrapper delegate-invoke) System.Action`1<OpenRA.TraitPair`1<OpenRA.Traits.ITick>>:invoke_void__this___T (OpenRA.TraitPair`1<OpenRA.Traits.ITick>)
  at OpenRA.WorldUtils.DoTimed[TraitPair`1] (IEnumerable`1 e, System.Action`1 a, System.String text) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.World.Tick () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Loop () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Run () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 

Played the same scenario in an earlier playtest without problems. Now happens every time.

data.title: Firing over barbed wire and sandbags
data.body:
In the original games, I believe units could fire over barbed wire and sandbags, but that it would block the paths of light vehicles and infantry.

In oRA, these seem to block projectiles too, making them more like cheap weak walls. I think it would be  more interesting to allow units to shoot through them but still block the paths of light vehicles and infantry.

That is unless it is actually a ray-caster issue that these units can't fire over them?
